name: Sausage Spanakopita Triangles
author: Wanderzest
summary: These Jimmy Dean® sausage spanakopita triangles are a fun and unique twist on the traditional Mediterranean appetizer. Filled with savory sausage, spinach, and cheese and then wrapped in phyllo dough, they make a great finger food or snack!
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Regular Sausage
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Add sausage to a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir with a spatula, breaking apart the sausage until cooked, 5 to 7 minutes
Add spinach, green onions, and red pepper flakes
Continue cooking until the spinach is thawed, 3 to 5 minutes
Remove from heat and stir in ricotta cheese and feta cheese
Unwrap the phyllo dough and cover with a towel to keep it from drying out
Working with one sheet at a time, brush 1/2 of the sheet with melted butter
Place a 1/4 to 1/2 cup of filling in the top-left corner
Fold the bottom-left corner over into a triangle shape
Continue folding edge over edge until you reach the end of the dough and a triangle shape is formed
Place the triangle on the baking sheet
Brush all the triangles with melted butter
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 25 minutes
